intro_text: Your patrol finds a loner who is interested in joining the Troop. They banter with the scavenger a bit, making them feel more welcome.
decline_text: Your patrol decides to leave the loner be.

success_outcomes.text: The patrol doesn't have to do much convincing. The loner seems happy to join the Troop.
The patrol doesn't have to do much convincing. The loner seems happy to join the Troop with their litter of kits.

fail_outcomes.text: The loner has a pleasant chat with the patrol, but ultimately they decide not to join.

antag_fail_outcomes.text: The patrol approaches the loner and tries to explain that c_n currently has enough mouths to feed, but the loner seems to take offense and leaves in a huff.

antag_success_outcomes.text: Your patrol approaches the loner and tells them firmly that newcomers aren't being taken in right now. The loner seems disappointed, but leaves anyway.

intro_text: r_c finds a wounded scavenger at the bottom of a long drop.
decline_text: They leave the wounded scavenger alone.

success_outcomes.text: The patrol approaches the injured scavenger and sees signs of life. Alarmed, they gently pick up the stranger and take them back to camp to be treated by the healer. The grateful scavenger decides to join the Troop.

fail_outcomes.text: As r_c inspects the scavenger, {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/find/finds} that they have already passed into their next life. The patrol takes a moment to bury them.
The patrol attempt to carry the stranger back to camp, but don't make it in time. They stop to bury the stranger before continuing home.

antag_fail_outcomes.text: The patrol attempts to help the scavenger to a healer nearby, but the scavenger passes before they can make it. They bury the scavenger outside their borders.

antag_success_outcomes.text: Your patrol helps the scavenger to the nearest healer. They can't spare the herbs for an outsider right now.

intro_text: p_l finds a wounded scavenger near the bottom of a long drop.
decline_text: p_l leaves the wounded scavenger alone.

success_outcomes.text: p_l approaches the stranger and sees signs of life. Alarmed, {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} gently {VERB/p_l/pick/picks} up the scavenger and {VERB/p_l/take/takes} them back to camp to be treated by the healer. The grateful stranger decides to join the Troop.

antag_success_outcomes.text: p_l helps the scavenger to the nearest healer. c_n can't spare the herbs for an outsider right now.

intro_text: r_c finds an abandoned kit whose parents are nowhere to be found.
decline_text: The patrol goes to approach when the missing queen appears, sliding out their claws in defense of their baby. Nevermind!

success_outcomes.text: r_c rushes the kit back to camp. The kit is nursed back to health and promised a place in the Troop.

fail_outcomes.text: The kit is rushed back to camp, but grows weak and dies a few days later.
The patrol approaches the kit, only to realize that it's already gone. They say a small prayer and bury it.

antag_fail_outcomes.text: Your patrol attempts to take the kit to a neighboring Troop instead of leaving it, but it dies on the journey. They give it a small burial.

antag_success_outcomes.text: Your patrol can't bear to leave the kit alone, so they take it to the border of the closest Troop and wait for a patrol to arrive. The other Troop agrees to take the kit.

intro_text: r_c finds a loner who offers their healing skills in exchange for shelter.
decline_text: Your patrol politely declines their offer.

success_outcomes.text: The new healer is welcomed into the Troop.
The new healer is welcomed into the Troop along with their batch of cubs.

fail_outcomes.text: After hearing more about your Troop, the loner politely declines joining.

antag_fail_outcomes.text: The patrol says that they can't take on another scavenger right now and tries to direct the loner somewhere else, but the loner scowls and says that they can find their own way.

antag_success_outcomes.text: The patrol says that they can't take on another scavenger right now, but they point the loner in the direction of the neighboring Troop.

decline_text: p_l politely declines their offer.

success_outcomes.text: The new healer is welcomed into the Troop.
The new healer is welcomed into the Troop along with their batch of cubs.

fail_outcomes.text: After hearing more about your Troop, the loner politely declines joining.

antag_fail_outcomes.text: p_l says that c_n can't take on another scavenger right now and tries to direct the loner somewhere else, but the loner hisses and says that they can find their own way.

antag_success_outcomes.text: p_l says that c_n can't take on another scavenger right now, but {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} {VERB/p_l/point/points} the loner in the direction of the neighboring Troop.

intro_text: Your patrol cautiously moves towards the sound of a lizard's fizzing. Near the border, they spot the monster chasing something. Oh no, it's a scavenger!
decline_text: The patrol decides not to interfere. Surely the scavenger can handle itself, the lizard isn't even that big.

success_outcomes.text: The patrol swiftly jumps into action. They rush the lizard, tossing cherrybombs to drive it into a panic, then chasing after it to try and stick it with their spears. r_c stays hidden while the rest of the patrol take care of the beast, then heads over to the stranger. They're unharmed, and this display of bravery makes them want to join the Troop!

s_c leaps into action, rushing the lizard and throwing a spear right at its face. With a clang the length of rebar bounces off the hard carapace there, stunning the lizard long enough for s_c to snatch their weapon back up and stab it into the beast's side. The loner, ruffled but unharmed, is amazed by this display. After some chatting, they decide to join the Troop.

fail_outcomes.text: The patrol swiftly jumps into action, chucking rocks and cherrybombs to throw the lizard into a panic. r_c stays hidden while the others chase after it, but when {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/go/goes} to find the stranger, {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/see/sees} that it's still running! Oh well, at least they're alright.

The patrol jumps into action and chases the lizard off without much difficulty. A group of scavengers is much different than a single one. However, the distressed loner seems to think that they're a threat and takes a swipe at r_c before running off.

history_text.scar: m_c was scarred when a loner attacked {PRONOUN/m_c/object}.
history_text.reg_death: m_c died after a loner attacked {PRONOUN/m_c/object}.

antag_fail_outcomes.text: The loner scrambles up a pole and kills the lizard themself by dropping behind it as it climbs after them. Dusting themself off, they scowl at the patrol, who stood by watching. The patrol leaves, guilt pricking at them.

antag_success_outcomes.text: Your patrol watches as the loner scrambles up the side of a building to escape the lizard, and then promptly proceed to chase the beast out of the territory. On their way back, they advise the loner that this is a dangerous area and maybe they shouldn't return.

intro_text: As the patrol is checking the border lines, they hear an odd sound coming from a nearby bush.
decline_text: It's probably nothing. The patrol leaves the noise alone and continues on their way.

success_outcomes.text: Before p_l can move to check the bush, a haggard loner emerges. The scavenger explains that they would like to join the Troop and after a short conversation with p_l, the loner and their family join the patrol on the journey back to camp.

p_l creeps towards the bush to check on the noise when lantern mouse suddenly bursts out with a loner on its heels! The loner speaks to p_l about Troop life, and how safe it would be for their newborn grubs. p_l convinces the family to join the Troop.

s_c takes the lead in checking the noise and finds that the bush is hiding a loner! The little pool behind them is inhabited by a batch of newborn grubs. s_c is quick to sit and talk quietly with the new parent. After some coaxing, s_c convinces them to come stay with the Troop for a while, maybe even to join permanently.

fail_outcomes.text: p_l shuffles closer to the bush, intent on finding the source of the noise, only to come face to face with a centipede! The poor scavenger narrowly escapes a nasty shock.

s_c doesn't even hesitate before splitting from the patrol to check on the source of the noise. {PRONOUN/s_c/subject/CAP} quickly {VERB/s_c/regret/regrets} {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} impulsivity, however, when an angry noodlefly bursts from the bush! s_c gets quite the scare, but thankfully the noodlefly only wanted to get away from {PRONOUN/s_c/object} and zips off into the sky.

p_l takes the lead in checking the source of the noise and comes face to face with a rogue hiding in the bush! The rogue takes a swipe at p_l, but doesn't get much damage in before p_l retaliates and chases the intruder out c_n territory.

history_text.scar: m_c gained a scar after tussling with a loner.

antag_fail_outcomes.text: A loner and their cubs emerge from the bush, but p_l shakes {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} head, and {VERB/p_l/tell/tells} the loner {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} meant it when {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} said {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} didn't want to see them again. The loner scowls and swipes at p_l. Rumors start at camp over what p_l said to the loner.

antag_success_outcomes.text: A loner and their cubs emerge from the bush, but p_l shakes {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} head, and {VERB/p_l/inform/informs} them there's no room in c_n.

intro_text: While searching for some specific herbs p_l is startled by weird sounds and whispers on the wind.
decline_text: Unnerved and unable to discern if it is a sign from StarClan or nothing, {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} {VERB/p_l/go/goes} back to c_n to ask for help and guidance.

success_outcomes.text: The sounds die away and then start up again in strange, unpredictable intervals. Investigating, p_l suddenly finds {PRONOUN/p_l/self} nose to nose with a panting, bleeding queen, one desperately splashing water from a tiny puddle on a stranded batch of larvae. p_l brings the queen back to camp, where the Troop can assist.

p_l follows the strange sounds on the wind and finds a struggling queen with their newborn grubs clinging to them. r_c sprints back to camp to find help while p_l tries to make the queen eat some strengthening herbs. Thankful for the help, the queen joins c_n with their cubs.

fail_outcomes.text: p_l follows the strange sounds on the wind and finds the bodies of an unknown queen with their cubs beside them, slowly going cold. r_c goes back to camp to find help bringing their bodies back to camp to pay respects.

antag_fail_outcomes.text: p_l begrudgingly follows the sound, only to find the bodies of an unknown queen and their cubs beside them. If p_l had been quicker... Whatever the case, {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} {VERB/p_l/return/returns} home, {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} mind clouded.

antag_success_outcomes.text: p_l scowls at StarClan for the sign, refusing to follow it to its source, and what might have been.

intro_text: While searching for some specific herbs p_l is startled by weird sounds and whispers on the wind.
decline_text: Unnerved and unable to discern if it is a sign from StarClan or nothing, {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} {VERB/p_l/go/goes} back to c_n to ask for help and guidance.

success_outcomes.text: p_l, sure that it is a sign of StarClan, follows the faint wailing. Instead {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} {VERB/p_l/find/finds} a queen who lost their life in a harsh birthing. Their newborn grubs wiggle now and then in the trickle of water from a pipe, which must have been pulled out of place at the last moment by hands determined to keep them alive. p_l hesitates, but hunches over the cubs and orders r_c back to the camp to fetch a bucket.

It takes ages for p_l to pinpoint the sounds, but eventually {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} {VERB/p_l/uncover/uncovers} a batch of stranded grubs, slowly dehydrating as they crawl on the cold body of their parent. p_l makes sure the queen is given a vigil - as the kits grow older, they'll have questions about their parent.

p_l follows the strange sounds on the wind and finds a struggling queen trying to keep their newborn batch of larvae hydrated in a tiny puddle. p_l tries to make the queen eat some strengthening herbs, and slowly helps them back to camp. Thankful for the help, the queen joins c_n with their cubs.

fail_outcomes.text: p_l follows the strange sounds on the wind and finds the body of an unknown queen with their cubs beside them, slowly going cold. {PRONOUN/p_l/subject/CAP} {VERB/p_l/cancel/cancels} {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} patrol and {VERB/p_l/return/returns} to camp to get help sending these lost souls to StarClan.

Their newborn grubs wiggle now and then in the trickle of water from a pipe, which must have been pulled out of place at the last moment by hands determined to keep them alive. p_l instantly scoops up the grubs and starts looking for a better place to submerge them so they can safely be moved to camp.

It takes ages for p_l to pinpoint the sounds, but eventually {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} {VERB/p_l/uncover/uncovers} the hidden spawning pool of a dead, cold queen, their newborn grubs flitting unaware through their tiny home. p_l makes sure the queen is given a vigil - as the cubs grow older, they'll have questions about their parent.

Panicking, {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} {VERB/p_l/ask/asks} the queen to hold on just a little longer while {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} {VERB/p_l/fetch/fetches} help, then {VERB/p_l/sprint/sprints} for home, looking around frantically in case any patrol is nearby to assist.

It takes ages for p_l to pinpoint the sounds, but eventually {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} {VERB/p_l/uncover/uncovers} the hidden spawning pool of a dead, cold queen, their newborn cubs flitting through the water in blissful ignorance. p_l vows to be the cubs' new family, to make sure they'll grow up loved and accepted.

fail_outcomes.text: p_l follows the strange sounds on the wind and finds the body of an unknown queen with their cubs beside them, slowly going cold. {PRONOUN/p_l/subject/CAP} desperately {VERB/p_l/try/tries} to save a grub, but can't, and a Troopmate finds {PRONOUN/p_l/object} there sobbing hours later.

antag_success_outcomes.text: p_l scowls at StarClan for the sign, refusing to follow it to its source, and what might have been.

intro_text: The patrol approaches a tall building when hunting. The slugcat Clowder that make their home within is known to the Troop, but they don't have regular contact.
decline_text: The patrol decides to hunt elsewhere.

success_outcomes.text: p_l hears the tapping of r_c's spear and drops the idea of following centipede tracks to hurry to {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} mate's side. r_c, head poked through a crack in the wall, beckons p_l to look through as well. p_l's eyes widen - there are scavenger cubs in there, all alone, and they need to be rescued before something happens to them!

Slipping into the building through a pipe, p_l suddenly hears the pattering of feet. p_l whips around just in time to get jumped on by a tiny, furious ball of fur brandishing a twig and squeaking a battle cry. But it's not a slugcat - it's a scavenger! Dropping {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} spear, p_l catches the cub in both hands as they struggle with all their might. r_c, called over by the sounds of battle, asks the little warrior what in the world they're doing. Why, they're defending their territory, of course! Upon consulting with the Clowder, the patrol learns that the slugcats have been struggling to keep the cubs healthy, and will gladly pass them into the Troop's care.

Squeaking furiously, a tiny scavenger cub comes barrelling out of the building to try and fight them with a twig and a pebble. Terrifying. s_c parries the blow with a tap of {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} spear and scoops the tiny warrior up - they can't leave them here. The cub insists that they're a big scavenger and they're fine, but after a couple of minutes lets slip that their mother is dead. A slugcat who soon comes out to greet the patrol confesses that the clowder has been struggling to care for the cubs - the Troop is welcome to take them.

fail_outcomes.text: As the patrol creep closer, they feel eyes on them. When they look up they jump at the sight of no less than a dozen slugcats watching them from high up on the wall, and quickly make like they were just passing by.

antag_fail_outcomes.text: A horde of armed slugcats burst out of the building and chase the patrol away. Miraculously, no one is injured, but p_l has a feeling they won't be so lucky next time.

antag_success_outcomes.text: The patrol invade the Clowder's camp while the majority of them are out, trashing the place, stealing their food, and terrifying the few still at home. They should know better than to try and make a home in c_n territory.

intro_text: As the patrol is checking the border lines, they hear the sound of a spear scraping as someone walks.
decline_text: They decide to leave it alone. It's probably just another Troopmate out in the territory.

success_outcomes.text: The patrol approaches warily and comes upon a scavenger, clearly from the city, sniffing around. The city scav notices their arrival and brightly says that they've heard about the Troop and wish to join. The patrol agrees to take them back to camp.

The patrol follows the noise and comes upon a scavenger, clearly from the city, sniffing around. The city scav notices them and scampers towards the patrol, who bristle in surprise. The city scav starts babbling about how they've been training for days now and they're finally ready to join c_n. Well... alright, then!

The patrol follows the noise and comes upon a scavenger, clearly from the city, sniffing around. The scavenger whips around and bristles, raising a spear at the patrol with a shaking hand. s_c calls out a greeting to them and engages them in conversation, which seems to calm them down. They even agree when s_c asks if they'd like to join the Troop!

fail_outcomes.text: The patrol follows the sound, intent on finding the intruder. They come upon a scavenger, clearly from the city, sniffing around. When the scavenger notices them, however, it turns tail and races off. At least it's off the territory now.

The patrol follows the sound, intent on finding the intruder. They come upon a scavenger, clearly from the city, sniffing around. They're about to approach calmly when s_c lets out a screech and rushes the stranger, who bushes up and flees.

The patrol follows the sound, ready to confront the intruder. They come upon a large scavenger, clearly from the city, sniffing around. They begin to approach, but the city scav raises their spear. r_c barely ducks out of the way in time to avoid getting impaled. p_l chases the stranger off and helps r_c back to camp.

history_text.scar: This cat gained a scar from a fight with an angry kittypet.

antag_fail_outcomes.text: The patrol follows the noise and comes upon a scavenger, clearly from the city, sniffing around. The stranger starts babbling about how they've been training for days now and they're finally ready to join c_n. p_l laughs, looking at the others in amusemnet, only to get whacked with the flat of the furious stranger's spear. Embarrassed, the patrol goes home, and the stranger stalks off in a huff.

antag_success_outcomes.text: The patrol follows the sound, intent on finding the intruder. A city scav! No wonder they were so loud. The patrol scares them off easily.

intro_text: The patrol is checking along the border lines when they hear a startling sound - a hiss of pain? They quickly follow the sound to the source. It's a loner, and they appear to be injured.
decline_text: It's probably nothing. The patrol leaves the noise alone and continues on their way.

success_outcomes.text: The patrol approaches cautiously. The loner draws themself up, but doing so causes them to let out another hiss. p_l offers to bring them to camp. Though they seem hesitant, the loner agrees.
The patrol approaches cautiously. The loner lifts their head and asks for help. p_l agrees. They can't leave someone who's done nothing wrong to die.

The loner bristles and glares as the patrol comes closer. s_c speaks soothingly to the loner, assuring them that they mean no harm and simply want to help. The loner seems distrustful, but allows p_l to help them back to camp.

fail_outcomes.text: The patrol warily approaches the loner, who doesn't seem to notice them. It's obvious that the scavenger is bleeding out. p_l attempts to staunch the bleeding and carry the stranger to camp, but it's no use. Hopefully they didn't suffer too much.

antag_fail_outcomes.text: The patrol approaches the loner cautiously, intending to attack. Instead, they find a StarClan warrior, who scolds them all for being willing to attack a hurt loner. With shame in their hearts, the patrol goes back home, and tells no one of what they saw.

antag_success_outcomes.text: The patrol launches into attack, only to find the loner that they've been fighting is too weak to fight back. They go home with blood on their hands.

intro_text: The air is thick and rank today in c_n's territory, and app1 is the only one stepping out. {PRONOUN/app1/subject/CAP}{VERB/app1/'re/'s} by {PRONOUN/app1/self} when {PRONOUN/app1/subject} {VERB/app1/see/sees} the blurry figure of a scavenger in the distance.
decline_text: Nope, not today, there's no way app1 is running after ghosts, no thank you.

success_outcomes.text: Approaching the figure, app1 finds a terrified city scav peering over a long drop that certainly wasn't there before, their fingers digging into the crumbled stones. When the stranger whips around to see app1, they babble about how their friends were just behind them a second ago, they can't be gone, the way back home can't be gone. app1's heart sinks. The only thing app1 can offer the inconsolable stranger is a new home to go to.

The stranger is perched atop one of a few thin poles, gazing out at the murky sky. When app1 squeaks to get their attention they whip around so fast they have to scramble to keep their balance, spines puffed out urchin-thick. Fortunately they're close enough for app1 to make out their furious gestures as they insist that they're not coming home, so app1 is wasting their time! Confused, app1 explains that they don't know each other, which calms the stranger done some. app1 offers to bring them back to camp, where it'll be safer to have a conversation. The stranger pauses before they start making their way down.

app1 approaches the figure to find a scavenger shivering and rocking in place, their arms wrapped around their knees. The apprentice introduces {PRONOUN/app1/self} cheerfully, and the city scavenger nearly falls over in their haste to wrap app1 in a desperately grateful hug.

fail_outcomes.text: The scavenger is scampering all over the place, and finally app1 gives up and goes home, too tired to catch more than a mouthful.
s_c calls out to the scavenger, only to be met with the clonk of a rock missing {PRONOUN/s_c/object} by a mile. Unbelievable! Sneering, s_c chucks a rock right back and storms off.

antag_fail_outcomes.text: app1 charges the figure with spear raised, only for the stranger to bowl {PRONOUN/app1/object} right over in their haste to get away.

antag_success_outcomes.text: app1 slams the butt of their spear on the ground, making the figure whip around with eyes nearly glowing through the fog. Only a little scared, app1 snaps that this is c_n's territory and there's no help for anyone else. The figure jumps down from their perch and swings away.

intro_text: The patrol hears desperate screams coming from a nearby lake.
decline_text: Whatever's going on, the scavenger doesn't sound familiar, so {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} {VERB/p_l/decide/decides} it's none of c_n's business.

success_outcomes.text: The patrol races towards the sound. They can make out a group of scavengers at the edge of the water, and as the patrol approaches they realise the one struggling in the grip of two others is an elder, and the water is seething with leeches. p_1 charges without stopping to think, the rest of the patrol right on their heels with spears ready to throw. While the rogues are distracted, r_c pulls the elder out of the midst of the fighting, promising them safety and welcome in c_n for as long as they like.

s_c sees the water seething with leeches, the elder struggling in the grip of two rogues at the water's edge, the leader with hand raised to give the signal to throw - it's now or never to save this poor scavenger. Snatching a cherrybomb off p_l, s_c hurls it right into the midst of the rogues. They drop the elder as they frantically look around for the source of the attack. The patrol takes their cue to charge. While the rogues are distracted, s_c sneaks over and carries the old scavenger inside to a safe hiding space. It's not long before the rogues make a break for it, and s_c spends the walk back to camp reassuring the stranger that they aren't a burden, and that c_n would welcome their wisdom and knowledge.

fail_outcomes.text: As soon as r_c sees the pack of rogues ready to throw an elder into the leech-filled water, {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/rush/rushes} the scavengers. A rogue turns, sneers, and rewards r_c's full-pelt run with the flat of their spear, slamming r_c hard into a wall. A splash, a shriek. The other rogues turn with eyes narrowed at the intrusion. p_l orders the patrol to protect and carry r_c while they retreat, with pain in their heart for the stranger they couldn't save.

Upon seeing the elder struggling in the grip of rogues ready to throw them into the water, s_c just can't take it. {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/jump/jumps} into action without waiting for the rest of the patrol to back {PRONOUN/s_c/object} up and pays the price. A rogue catches s_c with the flat of their spear and slams them against a wall. The only thing the rest of the patrol can do is grab s_c and flee back to the safety of c_n, the elder's scream and the splashing of leeches ringing in their ears.

antag_fail_outcomes.text: Seeing a group of rogues doing something at the water's edge, p_l turns the patrol away. It's not their problem. Still, when they hear a loud splash and a shriek, everyone goes quiet. A shameful silence hangs over the rest of the patrol.

antag_success_outcomes.text: As soon as the patrol realises it's a group of rogues at the water's edge, they turn and carry on. Rogues are not their problem.

intro_text: The patrol comes across a o_c_n apprentice, waiting quietly at the border. When the apprentice notices the patrol, they press themselves to the ground, begging to join c_n.
decline_text: This seems like a o_c_n problem. They order the apprentice to go back home and continue the patrol.

success_outcomes.text: The patrol brings the apprentice back to camp, where {PRONOUN/n_c:0/subject} {VERB/n_c:0/are/is} accepted into the Trop. This doesn't exactly help relations with o_c_n.

The patrol brings the apprentice back to camp. At first, the Troop wants to send {PRONOUN/n_c:0/object} home, but {PRONOUN/n_c:0/subject} {VERB/n_c:0/refuse/refuses} to leave. Reluctantly, c_n lets {PRONOUN/n_c:0/object} stay. o_c_n is not pleased.

s_c is eager to steal a o_c_n's apprentice right out from under their noses. {PRONOUN/s_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/s_c/stick/sticks} close to the apprentice on their way back to camp. At first, the Troop is unsure, but s_c vouches for n_c:0, and {PRONOUN/n_c:0/subject} {VERB/n_c:0/are/is} allowed to join the Troop.

fail_outcomes.text: The patrol brings the apprentice back to camp. However, c_n doesn't want to sully relations with o_c_n, and the apprentice is escorted home.
The patrol brings the apprentice back to camp. However, the Troop is unwelcoming, and the apprentice slips out in the middle of the night, dejected.

s_c knows accepting this apprentice will cause conflict with o_c_n, and c_n can't risk a war. Still, {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/want/wants} to help. {PRONOUN/s_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/s_c/subject/sit/sits} with the apprentice for a while, listening to their problems and offering advice. The apprentice returns home with a new prespective.

antag_fail_outcomes.text: This apprentice is clearly a spy, sent by o_c_n to weaken c_n. The patrol drives the apprentice away, but they put up a good fight.

antag_success_outcomes.text: This apprentice is clearly a spy, sent by o_c_n to weaken c_n. The patrol sends them home, bleeding from a few new scratches.
